frame.name: Repayment
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Debtor</fen> gives a <fen>Loaner</fen> <fen>Money</fen> in return for having borrowed <fen>Money</fen> at an earlier time. Alternatively, the type of <fen>Loan</fen> can be expressed as the object of repayment.
</def-root>

FE.name: Loaner
FE.definition:
<def-root>The person who is owed <fen>Money</fen> by the <fen>Debtor</fen>.
<ex>If you borrow, you'll have to <t>repay</t> <fex name="Loaner">the bank</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Debtor
FE.definition:
<def-root>The person who is giving <fen>Money</fen> to the <fen>Loaner</fen> to return an earlier borrowed amount.
<ex><fex name="Debtor">I</fex> <t>paid</t> Johnson <t>back</t> for the movie ticket.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Money
FE.definition:
<def-root>The amount of <fen>Money</fen> that the <fen>Debtor</fen> gives to the <fen>Loaner</fen>, which may or may not be the full amount of the <fen>Loan</fen>.
<ex><t>Pay</t> me ba<t></t>ck <fex name="Money">my 20 dollars</fex>!</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Loan
FE.definition:
<def-root>A situation or a representative of a situation prior to repayment in which the <fen>Debtor</fen> uses the <fen>Loaner</fen>'s money.
<ex>You must <t>repay</t> <fex name="Loan">the mortgage</fex> in full.</ex></def-root>
